title: Introduction to demingx
text: demingx package implements heteroscedastic slope-errors--variables (EIV) model. generalizes classical Deming regression accounting known per-observation uncertainties x y, well estimating intrinsic scatter term ση2\sigma_\eta^2.

title: Introduction to demingx
text: simulate fit data known heteroscedastic errors:
code: library(demingx)  set.seed(42) d <- simulate_demingx(n = 50, beta = 1.5, sigma_eta = 0.2) fit <- fit_demingx(d)

title: Introduction to demingx
code: fit # Extended Heteroscedastic Deming Fit #   beta       = 1.6294 #   sigma_eta^2 = 0.0001 #   logLik     = -49.17 #   convergence code: 0

title: Introduction to demingx
code: ll <- function(beta, log_sigma2_eta) {   -demingx_loglik(c(beta, log_sigma2_eta), d) }  beta_seq <- seq(1.2, 1.8, length.out = 100) sigma_seq <- seq(log(0.01), log(0.3), length.out = 100)  grid <- expand.grid(beta = beta_seq, log_sigma2_eta = sigma_seq) grid$loglik <- mapply(ll, grid$beta, grid$log_sigma2_eta)  library(ggplot2) ggplot(grid, aes(beta, exp(log_sigma2_eta), z = loglik)) +   geom_contour_filled() +   scale_y_log10() +   labs(y = expression(sigma[eta]), x = expression(beta))

title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Jan Gleixner (2025). demingx: Extended Heteroscedastic Deming Regression. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/jan-glx/demingx.
code: @Manual{,   title = {demingx: Extended Heteroscedastic Deming Regression},   author = {{Jan Gleixner}},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/jan-glx/demingx}, }

what: Vectorized log-likelihood for the extended Deming model — demingx_loglik
title: Vectorized log-likelihood for the extended Deming model — demingx_loglik
text: Computes full log-likelihood heteroscedastic slope-errors--variables model. Optionally includes analytical gradient computation optimization.

title: Vectorized log-likelihood for the extended Deming model — demingx_loglik
Vectorized log-likelihood for the extended Deming model — demingx_loglik
text: par Numeric vector parameters: (beta, log_sigma_eta2). data Data frame columns x_obs, y_obs, s_x, s_y. compute_grad Logical; whether compute attach analytical gradients.

title: Vectorized log-likelihood for the extended Deming model — demingx_loglik
text: log-likelihood value (scalar). compute_grad = TRUE, result attribute gradient containing analytical partial derivatives.

title: Vectorized log-likelihood for the extended Deming model — demingx_loglik
code: dat <- simulate_demingx(100, 2, 0.3) par <- c(1.5, log(0.3^2)) demingx_loglik(par, dat) #> [1] -141.8924 #> attr(,"gradient") #> [1] 80.832158  4.222016

what: Fit an extended heteroscedastic Deming regression — fit_demingx
title: Fit an extended heteroscedastic Deming regression — fit_demingx
text: Fits slope intrinsic scatter heteroscedastic errors--variables model using full-likelihood estimation. Supports analytical numerical gradient optimization.

title: Fit an extended heteroscedastic Deming regression — fit_demingx
Fit an extended heteroscedastic Deming regression — fit_demingx
text: data Data frame columns x_obs, y_obs, s_x, s_y. use_grad Logical; whether use analytical gradients. start Optional numeric vector starting values (beta, log_sigma_eta2).

title: Fit an extended heteroscedastic Deming regression — fit_demingx
text: list class demingx containing parameter estimates, log-likelihood, convergence information, call.

title: Fit an extended heteroscedastic Deming regression — fit_demingx
code: dat <- simulate_demingx(200, beta = 2, sigma_eta = 0.3) fit <- fit_demingx(dat) print(fit) #> Extended Heteroscedastic Deming Fit #>   beta       = 2.0776 #>   sigma_eta^2 = 0.0061 #>   logLik     = -219.83 #>   convergence code: 0

what: Simulate data for an extended heteroscedastic Deming regression — simulate_demingx
title: Simulate data for an extended heteroscedastic Deming regression — simulate_demingx
text: Generates synthetic data heteroscedastic slope-errors--variables model per-observation known standard errors x y.

title: Simulate data for an extended heteroscedastic Deming regression — simulate_demingx
code: simulate_demingx(   n,   beta,   sigma_eta = 0.3,   mu_x = -0.7,   tau_x = 0.3,   mu_y = -0.7,   tau_y = 0.3 )

title: Simulate data for an extended heteroscedastic Deming regression — simulate_demingx
text: n Number observations. beta True slope parameter. sigma_eta Intrinsic scatter (standard deviation y_true conditional x_true). mu_x, mu_y, tau_x, tau_y Parameters lognormal distributions used draw s_x s_y.

title: Simulate data for an extended heteroscedastic Deming regression — simulate_demingx
text: data frame columns x_obs, y_obs, s_x, s_y.

title: Simulate data for an extended heteroscedastic Deming regression — simulate_demingx
